features: Pretend doctor playset with 7 medical tool play pieces, including stethoscope, blood pressure cuff, thermometer, otoscope, syringe, bandage & fabric 'doctor' bag
Press button on thermometer to go from “sick” to “well”
Pump the blood pressure cuff to see the gauge spin
All play pieces store inside the bag, so making “house calls” is a breeze
Encourages imaginative pretend play and healthy habits for preschool kids ages 3 years and older
Smilestones: Bringing a smile to milestones! This toy helps foster Kindness by encouraging kids to help others and have empathy for their 'patients'
body.description: With the Fisher-Price Medical Kit, preschool kids can “treat” and “care for” patients with endless doctor role-play! This playset features 7 medical-themed play pieces for mini-MDs to use, including a stethoscope to 'listen' to their patient's heart, thermometer to 'check' their temperature, an otoscope to take a peek inside their ears, and a blood pressure cuff with a spinning gauge. Even getting a shot becomes fun with the toy syringe and a bandage cuff for pretend ouchies.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Smilestones: Bringing a smile to milestones At Fisher-Price, we know play and development go hand in hand. From bright colors & textures that engage their senses, to activities that get them sitting up & crawling, and interactive friends that introduce first words & spark imaginations, Fisher-Price toys help make reaching those important milestones (and everything in between) so much fun.

A healthy dose of pretend play The Fisher-Price Medical Kit has everything kids need for exciting doctor role-play. Playing out the experience of going to see the doctor not only helps preschoolers develop healthy imaginations, it also can help them understand how doctors help keep them healthy, so they can keep on playing!

Kids can “listen” to their patient’s heartbeat with the pretend stethoscope Take a peek inside the patient’s ears with the pretend otoscope Preschoolers will have a blast practicing their doctor skills

This toy helps develop: Imaginative Play Storytelling Healthy Habits Say hello to happier parenting Our early childhood development experts at the Fisher-Price Play Lab have been watching and learning from babies & big kids for decades. Their research helps us design toys and baby gear that foster growth & learning in the most fun ways. Because after 90 years of making toys, we know development happens naturally when fun leads the way!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We’ve bought a few different dr kits this past year and they all fall apart in 2 minutes. This one does not and kicking myself for all the wasted money. It’s not sparkly, it doesn’t make sounds. It works and holds together and didn’t break the bank or just didn’t break in general

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great learning resource
reviews.reviewText: SEL could be encouraged through this type of play. It can also be used to learn about the profession or what will happen when a child goes to the doctor to decrease anxiety.All of the pieces are the perfect size for a toddler or young child and high-quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great pretend play!
reviews.reviewText: This is perfect for my child who is a little weary of doctors. We got this so they could get comfortable with being at the doctors as well as sparking their imagination with pretend play. Only thing I would change is that the stethoscope is a bit stiff and harder for them to manage using/ putting on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my child and she absolutely loves it! Only downfall was the stethoscope is a little more flimsy then I would prefer (makes it hard to keep in the ears) but overall great quality otherwise!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good variety for a good price
reviews.reviewText: Our son's pediatrician recommended we buy him a toy doctor kit to work on doctor's office anxiety. He's still a little too much of a busy body to really focus on playing doctor, which is understandable at 2 years old. Nevertheless, he has a good idea on how to use each piece. He has a lot of fun packing everything into the bag that comes with this set, running around the living room, and then dumping it back out. He loves using the stethoscope and thermometer. Everyone and everything gets their "temperature" taken multiple times a day. We chose this set because we liked the variety of "tools" and we're very happy with our decision. This would make a fun gift for any kid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun for pretend play
reviews.reviewText: Such fun for pretend play, just wish the pieces had a little more functionality. (Lights, sounds, buttons)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I gifted this to my niece and she loves playing with it. Well made and durable to being dropped

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Comparison To Old Kit
reviews.reviewText: Back when I was younger, 70s-80's, my siblings & I had one of these kits & we loved it so when I had my son in ' 97' the Fisher Price doctor kit was on my to buy list when he got a little older. This review is a comparison between the kit I bought my son in '99' & the new kit I just bought for my almost 3yr old niece.1. The kit I bought my son has held up for 22yrs of play between my son, his friends, my friends kids that I have babysat for over the years & all my nieces and nephews. This new set I just bought does not in any way seem like it will hold up for more then 2-3yrs before needing to be replaced.2. Carrying Bag/Box: I have to admit I'm torn on which one of these is better. The bag easier to get things in & out of because even after 22yrs the box is still hard to open & close for little ones, however the box has the cute dry erase chart on the front for kids to check things off as they make sure your not sick. So for now I'm going to use the bag but when my niece gets a little older I plan to bring the box back out.3. Blood Pressure Band: I am loving the larger band in the new set as it's much easier to get on, the pressure box is a bit dull & boring though & I'm pretty sure if it gets stepped on by an adult accidentally it will break. The older version band is sooo small & can barely fit on a child's lower arm but the pressure box spins inside and is just a bit more interesting then the newer one. Also, I have stepped on it many times over the years & the most that happens is my foot gets hurt so I might just let my niece pick which one she prefers.4. Thermometer: This is the real reason I bought this kit, to upgrade from a mouth thermometer to a forehead one. With the pandemic the last thing I want is kids taking turns putting this thing in their mouth or my niece putting it in her mouth & then trying to get me to let her take my temp & vis versa. The older one is sturdier then the new one but both are cute. For now the new one will go in the bag & the old one inside the box & into a storage bin.5. Eye and Ear: I prefer the older one because it has a piece of hard, clear plastic in the middle to make looking thru it better and is WAY more durable in feel. The new one feels like it will shatter the first time it is stepped on.6. Band-aid and Shot: Both items are comparable in both sets. The new band-aid is slightly smaller then the older one but it's just barely noticeable. I am putting both band-aids in the bag and the old shot because I like the look of the old one better.7. Stethoscope: The new stethoscope is horrid!! The ear buds are HUGE & that's saying a lot because they have always on the larger side. I remember the set I had as a kid didn't fit in our ears & my sons stethoscope buds are to large to fit in the ear also. The new one has no sound to it were as the old one did. The one I had as a kid & my sons you could hear a heart beat with, it wasn't super strong sound but you could hear it. Even with the foam padding disintegrating, due to age, you can still make a out light heart beat sound. The way the upper part of the new ones curve in at the top part also adds to problems of keeping the Stethoscope in the ears. Like some other reviewers said they did I went & bought a real toddler stethoscope. I do plan to re-add foam to the old sets stethoscope because that piece is the one the kids fight over so having 2 were a heart beat can be heard would be nicer. The new set stethoscope will go in the box and into storage. In the end I like the older Fisher Price doctors kit more then the newer one. The quality of the newer set is just not there & seems to be designed to break within a few years or the first time an adult steps on it by accident. I know they design the ear buds on the stethoscope to be large enough that if a kid pulls them off another they're not being pulled out of the ear just off & so kids can't stuff them up there nose but the new buds are just much to large and to flat. The newer shot & thermometer are the sturdiest part of this set & that's not saying a whole lot. If you have or can find an older set I'd say that would be a better use of money then buying this new set. The foam in most older sets is probably gone, which is a turn off, but you can replace it or just buy a working stethoscope for children(the one I bought was only $7).

Best play doctor kit around for price, quality and amount of tools in kit!Come with-stethoscope-otoscope-pretend needle-blood pressure cuff- thermometerAnd cute little bag to hold it in.Great for pretend play, and for prepping your little for doctors appointment to make life easier and less pushback because of nervousness.Also this kit has made it through two toddlers and many cousins haha and still everything works great!

Se lo compré a mi sobrina de dos años, todo está muy sencillo de utilizar, los colores son bonitos y en general se siente resistente. Lo único es que el estetoscopio es un poco grande, así que de momento solo lo utiliza llevándolo en el cuello.

Regalo della befana per un bambino di 3 anni. Arrivato in una confezione grande e ben sigillata, esteticamente perfetta. Attrezzi molto carini e resistenti, il nostro bimbo si diverte molto a visitare chiunque passi da casa nostra 🤣

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Really sturdy and great that its in a bag rather than a box that breaks, bought for my 2 year old granddaughter who loves it. Would buy again

reviews.reviewTitle: Tolles Spielzeug zum günstigen Preis – Qualität passt ebenfalls 🥼☺️
reviews.reviewText: Dieses Set haben wir für unsere 4-jährige Tochter zu Weihnachten im vergangenen Jahr gekauft und es wird noch immer sehr gerne zum Verarzten von Mama, Papa oder einfach einem Plüschtier hergenommen. 😅👍Die Gründe weshalb wir uns für diesen Artikel entschieden haben waren u. a. folgende:- Preis-/ Leistung vollkommen in Ordnung (Mitbewerber sind oft sogar deutlich teurer)- Bekannte gute Qualität von Fisher-Price (größtenteils hartes Plastik)- Tragetasche (alles ist übersichtlich und kann optimal transportiert werden - sonst oftmals Koffer)- Angenehme Farben (auch für die Eltern)Unterstützt wurde das alles natürlich durch die große Anzahl der positiven Bewertungen hier auf Amazon. 😉Nachdem wir das Arzt-Set nun seit fast einem Jahr in Gebrauch haben, kann ich es jedem wärmstens weiterempfehlen. Die Qualität ist super und der Preis dafür gerechtfertigt. Unser Kind spielt heute auch noch sehr gerne damit und möchte nicht mehr darauf verzichten wollen. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
